commentBody:
Mr. Corbett wrote: "A pileup of three long, complicated sentences in a row is particularly exhausting for readers."

For this particular example of three long sentences in a row (each a single paragraph), I found reading them to be considerably easier than many examples of difficult sentences mentioned in this space. Quite possibly all that is needed is to chop the long sentences into shorter ones. (And to remove the Steffen Seibert reference.)
